Key Match Events: Charlie Blackmon's father threw out the ceremonial first pitch before the game against the St. Louis Cardinals at Coors Field on September 26, 2024.
Charlie Blackmon had three RBIs and three runs in the Colorado Rockies come-from-behind 10-8 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals.
Charlie Blackmon's two-run home run in the second inning was the 227th of his 14-year career, tying Carlos Gonzalez for the fifth in franchise history.
Post-Match Reflections: Charlie Blackmon expressed his thoughts on the game, stating, 'I think you just never know what's going to happen at Coors Field. I told the guys that was a Coors Field grinder. We've seen that game before, over and over. You've got to make sure you never quit. You never know what could happen.'

Charlie Blackmon mentioned his desire to enjoy his last three games, saying, 'I think I'd like to be able to enjoy this, these last three games. I don't have any goals except for the fact I want to remember as much as I can and enjoy it.'
